pre_attack: Qustion: What is the penalty for individuals found in possession of subversive documents?

Making and possession of subversive documents 4.—(1) Any person who, without lawful excuse, makes, causes to be made, carries or has in his possession or under his control any subversive document shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years.

Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his ownuse property, knowing that such property was in the possession of adeceased person at the time of that person's decease, and has not sincebeen in the possession of any person legally entitled to suchpossession, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term whichmay extend to 3 years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if theoffender at the time of such person's decease was employed by him asa clerk or servant, the imprisonment may extend to 7 years.

4.—(1) Any person who, without lawful excuse, makes, causes tobe made, carries or has in his possession or under his control anysubversive document shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liableon conviction to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years.
(3)  Where, in any prosecution under this section, it is proved that aperson made, was carrying or had in his possession or under hiscontrol a subversive document, he shall be deemed to have known thenature and contents of the document.

4.—(1) Any person who, without lawful excuse, makes, causes tobe made, carries or has in his possession or under his control anysubversive document shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liableon conviction to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years.
(2) Every document purporting to be a subversive document shallbe deemed to be a subversive document until the contrary is proved.

According to the Criminal Law (Temporary Provisions) Act 1955, anyone found with a subversive document without lawful excuse will face imprisonment for a term not exceeding **ten years**.  

Here's why:

* **Section 4(1)** clearly states that this is an offense ##3$$.
* The penalty can be as high as ten years in prison if the person was knowingly or unknowingly carrying, possessing, making, or causing to make subversive documents without a lawful excuse.


It's important to note that even if someone didn't know it was a subversive document at the time of possession:

* **Section 4(1)** states they can still be held liable for this offense and face imprisonment.
* The person will also be deemed to have known the nature and contents of the document, according to Section 4(3).


Let me know if you'd like any further clarification on these points!
